titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Shenandoah Valley account books, 1841-1859 and undated RL.01175
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Library staff; machine-readable finding aid created by: Elizabeth Shesko, Paula Jeannet Mangiafico

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Collection consists of an estate inventory of Peter Helsley from Shenandoah Valley, Virginia, and three account books whose relationship to each other and to the estate inventory is unknown. Names of individuals associated with two of the account books are Henry Bowers and Kefflet and Brown; the only fact known about the third account book is that it comes from Conicville, Virginia.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Shenandoah Valley account books, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Shenandoah Valley account books were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a purchase.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Encoded by Elizabeth Shesko, Paula Jeannet Mangiafico, May 2011
Materials may not have been ordered and described beyond their original condition.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection dates from 1841-1859 and consists of an 1854 estate inventory of Peter Helsley from Shenandoah Valley, Virginia, and three apparently unrelated 19th century account books also from Shenandoah County. Names of individuals associated with two of the account books are Henry Bowers and Kefflet and Brown; the only fact known about the third account book if that it comes from Conicville, Virginia.

controlaccess.subject: Inventories of decedents' estates -- Shenandoah County (Va.)
